title: Gorpley Reservoir Walking Route

nearby.description: Todmorden to Hebden Bridge Canal Walk

images.title: Mick Melvin / Gorpley Clough
images.caption: Gorpley Clough. This is an unspoilt area of natural woodland with many waterfalls, and it is crossed by a number of wooden bridges.

images.caption: Gorpley Reservoir. Gorpley Clough walking from Counting Hill via Range Hoyle and then alongside the reservoir

images.caption: Sheep on the dam

description: This walk visits Gorpley Clough and Reservoir in Todmorden. The small reservoir and woodland area are located just west of the town. It's a fairly quiet place making for a pleasant and peaceful walk. You can start your walk from the Gorpley Clough car park off the A61 just west of Todmorden. From here you can pick up footpaths heading south west through the woodland of Gorpley Clough. On the way you'll pass the scenic Walker's Waterfall before coming to the small reservoir. Here you can enjoy some waterside footpaths before heading back on the same paths.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The woodland of the clough and the waterside trails at the reservoir make for a fine dog walk.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To extend your walking in the area you could pick up the Todmorden Centenary Way, the Todmorden to Hebden Bridge Canal Walk or the Calderdale Way. There's also a number of footpaths running onto the adjacent Inchfield Moor and Oatley Hill.

display_address: Bacup Road, Clough Foot, Todmorden, Walsden, Calderdale, West Yorkshire, England, OL14 7HX, United Kingdom
